results.title: Winnie the Pooh and Tigger too
results.creator_credit: John Lounsbery, Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Rambunctious Tigger bounces his way through this film, leaving a trail of laughter and enjoyment behind him. Poor Rabbit, driven to distraction by Tigger’s high spirits plots a “calming sort of lesson”. Narrated by Sebastian Cabot.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Lounsbery, Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Productions

results.title: Winnie the Pooh and the honey tree
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Anytime is the right time for honey according to Pooh. This film follows him through a series of misadventures brought about by a fondness for sticky treats. Suitable for children aged 4-10.

results.title: Winnie the Pooh and the blustery day
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: A blustery wind sweeps through the Hundred Acre Wood, toppling Owl’s tree home, and making everyone, especially Pooh, very uneasy.

results.title: The Tiny terrors
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, Tim Wilson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: They are out for your blood and they will probably get it, but fighting a rear-guard action on your behalf is the scientist discovering new ways to combat the menace of the biting fly. In government and university entomology laboratories, a full-scale study of insect behavior and methods of mosquito larvae control is under way.

results.title: Twin Peaks. Season one. Eps 5 and 6 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Caleb Deschanel, Lesli Glatter, Gregg Fienberg, Frost Productions and Lynch/Frost Productions
results.brief_description: EPISODE FIVE: In this episode, Agent Cooper and Sheriff Truman discover several new leads which point to the involvement of Leo Johnson and Jacques Renault in Laura’s murder. Audrey Horne continues to provide more unexpected assistance to the investigation as she infiltrates the nearby brothel, One-Eyed Jacks, in an effort to impress Agent Cooper. Meanwhile, Donna forms a new bond with James Hurley and Madeline, while Laura’s father, Leland Palmer, becomes even more unhinged. EPISODE SIX: Agent Cooper and Big Ed Hurley, James’ uncle, go undercover at the casino and brothel, One-Eyed Jacks, unaware of Audrey’s similar plans. Meanwhile James Hurley and Donna Hayward, suspicious of Laura’s psychiatrist, Dr. Jacoby, decide to lay a trap for him by disguising Madeline as Laura, back from the dead. Cast includes: Madchen Amick, Dana Ashbrook, Richard Beymer, Lara Flynn Boyle, Sherilyn Fenn, Warren Frost, Peggy Lipton, James Marshall, Everett McGill, Jack Nance, Ray Wise, Joan Chen, Piper Laurie, Eric Da Re, Harry Goaz, Michael Horse, Sheryl Lee, Russ Tamblyn, Grace Zabriskie, Miguel Ferrer, Walter Oklexicz, Royce D. Applegate and Kyle MacLachlan.

results.title: Twin Peaks. Season one. Ep. 7. Bonus features [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mark Frost, Gregg Fienberg and Lynch/Frost Productions
results.brief_description: EPISODE SEVEN: The final episode of the first season sees the climax of several important plotlines. Donna and James’ trap for Dr. Jacoby backfires after he is beaten and has a heart attack. Agent Cooper’s undercover infiltration of One-Eyed Jacks leads to a telling encounter with Jacques Renault, who confesses to his activities on the night of Laura’s murder. Meanwhile, Leo Johnson sets fire to the mill with his wife inside, unknowing of the plans for his own demise. Cast includes: Madchen Amick, Dana Ashbrook, Richard Beymer, Lara Flynn Boyle, Sherilyn Fenn, Warren Frost, Peggy Lipton, James Marshall, Everett McGill, Jack Nance, Ray Wise, Joan Chen, Piper Laurie, Eric Da Re, Harry Goaz, Michael Horse, Sheryl Lee, Russ Tamblyn, Grace Zabriskie, Miguel Ferrer, Walter Oklexicz, Royce D. Applegate and Kyle MacLachlan.

results.title: The Tin soldier. The Nightingale
results.creator_credit: Chris Schouten, Richard Morrison, W. H. Stevens, Wang Bairong, Atkinson Film Arts, Crawleys Animation and Shanghai Animation Films
results.brief_description: Two delightful animated children’s stories from the classic Hans Christian Anderson fairy tales, narrated by Christopher Plummer. “The Tin Soldier” is about friendship and love between a music box ballerina and a tin toy soldier. “The Nightingale” is an enchanting tale set in the mystical land of ancient China.

results.title: The Time of man
results.creator_credit: Marshall Flaum and Metromedia Producers Corporation
results.brief_description:
Man’s position in the long chain of evolution is portrayed with special emphasis on the problems of survival, pointing up man’s natural connection with all living organisms. Part of the series “The Natural history of the world” this film is presented in three sections:
I - Evolution and survival
II - Man and his humanity
III - Man’s modern history and survival
Narrated by Richard Basehart.
